snippet: The basement blast killed 37 people and injured more than 120 others at the headquarters of Petróleos Mexicanos, or Pemex, on Jan. 31.
abstract: Mexican officials say investigation shows that methane gas combined with vapors emitted by solvents caused deadly explosion at headquarters of Mexico’s state-owned oil monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos, or Pemex, in January 2013.
lead_paragraph: The basement blast killed 37 people and injured more than 120 others at the headquarters of Petróleos Mexicanos, or Pemex, on Jan. 31.

headline.main: Mexico: Blast Caused by Methane Gas, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Mexico: Blast Caused by Methane Gas, Report Says
